title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string is being accepted in the report design, instead it should be rejected. The model should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss) to ensure portability.
OB:
When creating a report parameter of type 'DateTime' in the BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string is entered in the 'default value' field (e.g., '55/66/9999'), it is accepted. The report design then shows the following definition:
<parameters>
  <scalarParameter name='dateParam1'>
    <property name='dataType'>dateTime</property>
    <property name='allowBlank'>false</property>
    <property name='format'>Unformatted</property>
    <property name='controlType'>textbox</property>
    <expression name='defaultValue'>55/66/9999</expression>
  </scalarParameter>
</parameters>
EB: The invalid date/time string should be rejected and the report designer should store a dateTime type constant using the XML schema date/time format (yyyymmddThh:mm:ss).
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter and set the type to 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
